Pionus

Blue-Headed Pionus

A stocky, medium-sized parrot with a brilliant blue head and neck, a green body, and red feathers under its tail. They have a distinctive bare white eye-ring.

Origin
Central & South America
Size
11 inches (28 cm). Weight: 230-295g (8.1-10.4 oz)
Weight
260g avg.
Noise Level
Low to moderate. Much quieter than Amazons or Macaws, making them very suitable for apartments.

Looking for a Blue-Headed Pionus?

See Available Blue-Headed Pionus Listings

Species Ratings

Talking Ability 1/10
Noise Level 5/10
Social Needs 9/10
Cuddliness 5/10

Temperament & Personality

Known for being exceptionally calm, quiet, and gentle. They are less demanding than many other parrots and make excellent, easy-going companions.

Vocalization & Talking Ability

Generally not known for their talking ability, though some individuals may learn a few words. They make soft, wheezing sounds when frightened, which is normal for the species.

Dietary Needs

A high-quality pelleted diet, supplemented with fresh vegetables and fruits. They are less prone to obesity than Amazons.

Health & Lifespan

Generally healthy and hardy, with a lifespan of 25-40 years. Can be prone to aspergillosis and vitamin A deficiency.

Housing Requirements

A medium-large cage with a minimum size of 24"W x 24"D x 36"H is appropriate. They enjoy toys but are not as destructive as other parrots.

Common Questions About Blue-Headed Pionus

What is the lifespan of a Blue-Headed Pionus?

The Blue-Headed Pionus typically lives for 25-40 years. With proper care, diet, and regular vet check-ups, they can live a full and healthy life.

Is the Blue-Headed Pionus good for beginners?

This species is rated as 'intermediate' care level. They require specific attention, socialization, or dietary needs that may challenge first-time owners.

Where does the Blue-Headed Pionus come from?

The Blue-Headed Pionus is native to Central & South America.
